page.title: 01 AN INTRODUCTION TO SARK
page.content: Sark is a relatively quiet island, situated in the English Channel 6 miles East of Guernsey, 14 miles North_west of Jersey and 24 miles West of France. Sark from north to south is 3\ miles, from its widest points, (West to East), it, is 1\ miles. The causeway that joins " Big Sark" to " Little Sark" is 150 yard's long, and 260 feet above sea level. Sark is almost a flat_topped plateau, 300 feet above sea_level, that contains some 1500 vergees of good agricultural land, (2.25 to 1 English acre), surrounded by sheer bracken covered cliffs, called Cotils.
